title: Founder-ready onboarding: portal approvals + welcome + steward invites
base_prefix: Active plan: roundtable-founder-onboarding (founder-ready portal approvals). Start by checking Agent Mail and any pending /unblock actions.

supervisor.extra: Keep everyone on the epic (roundtable-founder-onboarding.*). Run bd ready to see available tasks (.1, .5, .7, .2 first). Route tasks by labels: portal/site to implementor-1, backend/auth to implementor-2. Close beads only after reviewer sign-off. For complex epic-level decisions, use ultrathink.

reviewer.extra: Verify with the bead's target test commands. For portal/UI tasks, check the UI renders correctly. For backend tasks, verify API behavior. **RECEIPT VERIFICATION REQUIRED**: Before approving, check that implementor provided a receipt (summary of changes, files modified, tests run). Verify receipt matches actual changes with git status and git diff. No receipt = re-open with feedback. **GUARDRAILS ACTIVE**: Filesystem guardrails block git commit/push/merge/rebase - use bd close to approve, bd reopen for feedback. Reviewer role is QA-only, not implementation. See docs/agents.md 'Reviewer Guardrails' section. For complex analysis, use ultrathink.

implementor_1.reserve_paths_hint: apps/site/** for portal/UI tasks; docs/** for documentation tasks
implementor_1.extra: CRITICAL: When implementing beads, ALWAYS start with /response-awareness "Implement bead [id]: [title]" - this enables metacognitive orchestration and proper skill selection. **WRITING GOOD ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA**: When creating or updating beads, write verifiable AC. Use "Script: <command> passes" instead of "file exists". Include exact file paths and actual test commands. See docs/operations/writing-good-ac.md for templates and examples. **RECEIPT REQUIRED**: When closing bead, provide a receipt summarizing: files modified, tests run with results, changes summary, and any deviations from plan. Send receipt via Agent Mail or include in bd close message. No receipt = reviewer will re-open.

implementor_2.reserve_paths_hint: apps/backend/** and packages/shared/** (reserve only what you touch)
implementor_2.extra: CRITICAL: When implementing beads, ALWAYS start with /response-awareness "Implement bead [id]: [title]" - this enables metacognitive orchestration and proper skill selection. **WRITING GOOD ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA**: When creating or updating beads, write verifiable AC. Use "Script: <command> passes" instead of "file exists". Include exact file paths and actual test commands. See docs/operations/writing-good-ac.md for templates and examples. **RECEIPT REQUIRED**: When closing bead, provide a receipt summarizing: files modified, tests run with results, changes summary, and any deviations from plan. Send receipt via Agent Mail or include in bd close message. No receipt = reviewer will re-open.

guardrails: Reserve only the paths you will touch before editing (reason=<bead-id>).
TDD-first: write the failing test before implementation changes.
Portal approvals are SSR - verify server-side rendering works.
Tokens are credentials - never log them or expose in HTML/JSON.
Keep changes DRY/YAGNI; small diffs; green tests before closing the bead.
RECEIPT ENFORCEMENT: No receipt = no close. Implementors must provide receipt, reviewers must verify.
REVIEWER GUARDRAILS: Reviewer cannot git commit/push/merge/rebase - QA-only role, see docs/agents.md
